channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Major Health & Safety Issue Southam Road, 8th July
item.description:
Footpath leading to Sotham shown as closed when there is no alternative on the other side of the road forcing villagers to step in to fast moving traffic increased due to Evesham Road closure. I will contact the Health & Safety Executive about this issue unless the signs are removed immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shaw Green Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -FW6 Potholes problem, 8th July
item.description:
Give and take 28. Day footway pothole 700x300x20mm tarmac patch (FW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned signs cones & sandbags, 8th July
item.description:
These abandoned signs etc are restricting the only footpath on the Prestbury end of Southam Road. This is the second time I’ve reported this. Someone needs to manage your contractor Ringway as they are creating Health & Safety issues in Prestbury rather than solving problems.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Road, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Abandoned sign, 8th July
item.description:
Abandoned Ringway barrier & sandbag blocking crossing point. Original problem with raised hatch fixed by Environmental Agency weeks ago & reported to you. Is this what constitutes public service?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Morningside Close, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Subsidence in pavement-to-drainage ditch outside 27 Symphony Road, 8th July
item.description:
The previously reported cracks in the pavement outside my home at 27 Symphony Road have now deteriorated further. In the past few days the smaller part of the pavement is now raised and has clearly subsided towards the drainage ditch. In addition to this, my connection to our fibre internet box (on Messenger way) is now blocked below the path. Bt Openreach has also been informed. Thanks for your attention, Craige Hume 27 Symphony Road, Cheltenham, GL516GJ

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Symphony Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 8th July
item.description:
Give and take plus temporary footway closure required 28 day footway abrupt level different stats required please lift and replace broken multiple size slabs due to tree roots damage 3000x3000x40mm tarmac patch (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning bags ready for collection, 8th July
item.description:
Hi I left 2 street cleaning bags by the poo bin at the very top of Millfields, on the left handside GL3 3NH today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pitt Mill Gardens, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Litter picking bags ready for collection

item.title: Single yellow lines., 8th July
item.description:
After the recent roadworks the line painting has only added single yellow lines on one of the most important / busiest junctions on the Leckhampton Road. All other junctions have double yellow lines yet this hasn’t. The only exception. Double yellow lines were present beforehand. Ayou can see from the picture it’s already causing problems and creating unnecessary risk when sight lines are obscured.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 8th July
item.description:
Customer reports that temporary TS/works have been installed at the location, but there is nothing going on. They query what's happening and state that they cannot stay there, as they will be disruptive.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch has fallen from height..over 10 metres, 8th July
item.description:
Behind the Wincanton warehouse off Golf Club Lane. There is a public foot path next to the fallen tree. The tree is huge that is has fallen from and there is a wider risk to the public

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Golf Club Lane, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
